events.name: Intro to Appium (Mobile Test Automation Framework)
events.description:
Bring your Laptops!!! Mobile Apps Test Automation!!! Yes, this time we are learning from Syam Sasi @ IDA, about his experience in automating tests for mobile applications. Lots of mobile apps development is happening all around us, we need to get smarter at building quality mobile applications. We will soon send pre-requisite setup instructions, for now we expect you have Oracle VirtualBox installed on your laptops. 


Agenda: 6.30 pm to 7.15 pm:    Food and Networking 7.15 pm to 7.45 pm:     Introduction to Appium 7.45 pm to 9.00 pm:   Hands-on session with Appium

events.name: ProductTank #4: Product-Led Growth
events.description:
THEME:  GROWTH OpenView Venture Partners define Product-led growth as a "go-to-market strategy that relies on product features & usage as the primary drivers of customer acquisition, retention, and expansion". During the next ProductTank we'll explore how product management intertwines with growth, and take a closer look at the idea of Product-Led Growth. HOW TO RSVP: Due to the requirements of Facebook's security, attendees have to RSVP using their real names. Please RSVP via Eventbrite:  https://www.eventbrite.com/e/producttank-growth-tickets-27330578496 

SPEAKERS AND TALKS #1 Silvia Thom, Regional Director of Product Management, ZALORA: How to turn offline into online customers. At ZALORA, Silvia's team oversees both customer-facing products such as the websites and an Android and iOS apps, as well as internal systems used by Operations & Logistics, Customer Service, and Buying. Before joining ZALORA, Silvia led the Product Team at Glossybox, a beauty subscription service and was the Country Manager for Japan at Sellaband, a music crowdfunding platform.  Silvia is a native German who loves to travel and experience different cultures. She was based in Berlin, London, Madrid, and Tokyo before moving to Singapore at the beginning of 2013. 


#2 Yi-Wei Ang, Senior Growth Lead, TradeGecko: Achieving Growth is a marathon, not a sprint. Yi-Wei is currently leading the Growth team at TradeGecko. Prior to joining TradeGecko, he was a Product Manager at Microsoft and UX Researcher at IBM. 


AGENDA 18:30 - Registration starts. 19:00 - Registration ends. 19:05 - 19:35 - First speaker: talk and Q&A (20 min + 10 min) 19:35 - 19:50 - Break! 19:50 - 20:20 - Second speaker: talk and Q&A (20 min + 10 min) 20:20 - 21:00 - Networking. 21:00 - Event ends. 


Notes: • The exact schedule is subject to change, but we’ll definitely start by 7pm. • Registration closes at 01:00 on Wednesday, September 14. • Remember to bring your ID for a smooth check-in with the building security. :) • IMPORTANT: Please, try to be on time. Registration will close at 7pm, and in case you're late, you won't be able to enter until the break (7:35pm). This is due to building security's quirks, and the event host doesn't have control over it.
events.location: Facebook APAC, 38 Beach Road, South Beach Tower, 189673, Singapore

events.name: Xamarin Hands-On Lab : MVVM Best Practices
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, Level 22, Room CF12, One Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018989

events.name: Building A Pokémon Go Clone
events.description:
Pokémon Go has become the most popular game in the world, but do you know how it actually works? In this introductory workshop, you will learn more about how Pokémon Go works, and you'll get to build your own location-based game too. [ Who should join ] 。People who want to learn coding 。Aspiring entrepreneurs who want to build their own app 。People who are interested in location-based games [ What you will learn ] 。Basic iOS app development 。Key features of a location-based game/app 。Build your own Pokemon Go clone (that you can run on your own iPhone) [ Workshop details ] 。Date: 14 Sep 。Time: 7.30 - 9.30pm 。Venue: The Co. @ 99 Duxton 。Price: SGD 15 (Fully refundable at the end of the workshop) * * Please bring your own MacBook (updated to El Capitan) and install Xcode before workshop. [ Instructor ] Kale Toh Software Engineer, Singapore Tourism Board Over 7 years of software development experience. Previously iOS Development Instructor at ALPHA Camp and The Pragmatic Lab. Passionate in teaching and solving problems with code. 


*** This is a PAID event. Kindly register and pay directly https://dojo.alphacamp.co/events/building-a-pokemon-go-clone
